duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and publish resident schedules using scheduling software to ensure accurate and timely scheduling for 118 residents.
Communicate regularly with residents to understand scheduling preferences and needs.
Ensure compliance of work hours and clinical experience for trainees to meet board eligibility requirements.
Monitor and manage overnight call assignments and produce quarterly reports with call data.
Track and maintain records for residents' vacation requests, conference leaves, and away time.
Serve as backup to Residency Program Coordinators and provide miscellaneous support to the residency program.
Uphold existing policies and procedures while resolving complex and sensitive problems.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.
